elements.title: UK Power Networks open data portal
elements.description: Using this portal, users can discover more about UKPN work and assets. [LAEP](https://ukpowernetworks.opendatasoft.com/pages/laep/), [in the news](https://www.current-news.co.uk/news/ukpn-to-provide-datasets-to-support-local-authorities-in-reaching-net-zero) and released in Nov 2022, is made of 154 unique datasets required for 30 use cases towards planning for Net Zero

elements.title: EPC opendata communities
elements.description: Access to Energy Performance Certificates and Display Energy Certificates data for buildings in England and Wales. Searchable, browsable and downloadable individually or in bulk.

elements.title: Nesta EPC data analysis
elements.description: Repo for the analysis of the EPC dataset (check opendata communities) with a map visualisation of [heat pumps uptake in the uk]( https://nestauk.github.io/epc_data_analysis/Heat_Pump_Uptake_Map.html) visualisation using [kepler.gl](https://kepler.gl/)

elements.title: Awesense
elements.description: Access externally-built analytics, applications, queries, and notebooks. Sell and share your solutions on the Awesense marketplace and expand revenue streams. Based mainly in Vancouver

elements.title: Open Energy
elements.description: The Open Energy programme makes it easy to search, access and securely share energy data. It covers both Open Data and commercial Shared Data where access requires control. Developed and operated by [Icebreaker one](https://energy.icebreakerone.org/)

elements.title: Energy.gov resources, tools and dataset on open energy
elements.description: plenty of resources here, links to [NREL BITES](https://www.nrel.gov/analysis/bites.html), project discontinued and reframed under a number of other projects

elements.title: OpenEI
elements.description: The information you'll find on OpenEI is community driven, it is a collection of content and data provided by contributors ranging from experts to enthusiasts. The platform is a wiki, similar to Wikipedia’s Wiki, with which many people are already familiar.

elements.title: Subak
elements.description: Subak mission is to stop climate change by accelerating an ecosystem of innovative nonprofits using data and technology to influence policy and mass-market behaviour. Dan Travers ([Open Climate Fix](https://openclimatefix.org/)) is in the team

elements.title: Eliq
elements.description: Eliq provides software to monitor electricity usage and demand patterns. It takes information from smart metering, connected devices and weather analytics and interprets this to provide instant energy insights and promote efficiency. Awarded phase 2 of UK gov [SENS competition](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/smart-energy-savings-sens-competition)

elements.title: EnPowered
elements.description: Canada based EnPowered has a platform that measures Rates, capacity or demand charges, delivery fees - market spikes drive up costs in energy bills, making forecasts to plan usage and avoid costly events.

elements.title: Smap Energy
elements.description: SMAP Energy originated from research at the University of Cambridge. In collaboration with our academic and industrial partners, we’ve developed novel machine learning and AI techniques and products that take advantage of growing smart meter data reserves. [Acquired by Japanese firm ENECHANGE](https://www.current-news.co.uk/news/smart-meter-data-firm-smap-energy-snapped-up-by-enechange) in March 2021

elements.title: Green button data
elements.description: The [Green Button initiative](https://www.greenbuttonalliance.org/about) is an industry-led effort to respond to a White House call-to-action to provide electricity customers with easy access to their energy usage data in a consumer-friendly and computer-friendly format.

elements.title: Myst AI
elements.description: We use artificial intelligence to help energy companies better predict the future, resulting in lower costs, reduced risk and less waste. Secured $6M [series A funding](https://news.crunchbase.com/news/myst-ai-closes-6m-series-a-to-forecast-energy-demand-supply/) in Sept 2020

elements.title: Utility API
elements.description: Utility API , Web api platform for energy consumption and bills
